meanings.definition: The state or quality of being temporary.
meanings.sent1: The temporality of the flowers in the garden is evident as they bloom and wither quickly.
meanings.sent2: I understand the temporality of the situation, so I know it won't last forever.
meanings.sent3: The temporality of the ice cream cone was amusing as it melted faster than I could eat it.
meanings.sent4: She realized the temporality of youth when she saw her first gray hair.
meanings.sent5: The temporality of childhood summers always brings a sense of nostalgia.

meanings.definition: The concept of time or the way in which time is experienced.
meanings.sent1: In his writing, he often explores the temporality of memories and how they shape our present.
meanings.sent2: The temporality of the project deadline made everyone work efficiently to meet it.
meanings.sent3: The temporality of the clock's ticking became amusing as it seemed to speed up during boring meetings.
meanings.sent4: She pondered the temporality of life, realizing how quickly time passes by.
meanings.sent5: The temporality of the changing seasons reminds us of the cyclical nature of time.

meanings.definition: The condition of being subject to change or impermanence.
meanings.sent1: The temporality of fashion trends means styles come and go quickly.
meanings.sent2: The temporality of happiness is understood when one realizes it can be fleeting.
meanings.sent3: The temporality of the sandcastle was amusing as it was washed away by the tide within minutes.
meanings.sent4: He felt the temporality of fame as quickly as it had come, it was gone.
meanings.sent5: The temporality of the storm's fury left behind a landscape changed forever.
